TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed EfxEffectType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Effect type definitions to be used with EfxEffecti.EffectType.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType Autowah = int32(10)

Docs.summary: The Auto-wah effect emulates the sound of a wah-wah pedal used with an electric guitar, or a mute on a brass instrument.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType Chorus = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The Chorus effect essentially replays the input audio accompanied by another slightly delayed version of the signal, creating a "doubling" effect.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType Compressor = int32(11)

Docs.summary: The Compressor will boost quieter portions of the audio, while louder portions will stay the same or may even be reduced.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType Distortion = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The Distortion effect simulates turning up (overdriving) the gain stage on a guitar amplifier or adding a distortion pedal to an instrument's output.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType EaxReverb = int32(32768)

Docs.summary: The EAX Reverb has a more advanced parameter set than EfxEffectType.Reverb, but is only natively supported on devices that support the EAX 3.0 or above.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType Echo = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The Echo effect generates discrete, delayed instances of the input signal.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType Equalizer = int32(12)

Docs.summary: The Equalizer is very flexible, providing tonal control over four different adjustable frequency ranges.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType Flanger = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The Flanger effect creates a "tearing" or "whooshing" sound, like a jet flying overhead.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType FrequencyShifter = int32(6)

Docs.summary: The Frequency shifter is a single-sideband modulator, which translates all the component frequencies of the input signal by an equal amount.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType Null = int32(0)

Docs.summary: No Effect, disable. This Effect type is used when an Effect object is initially created.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType PitchShifter = int32(8)

Docs.summary: The Pitch shifter applies time-invariant pitch shifting to the input signal, over a one octave range and controllable at a semi-tone and cent resolution.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType Reverb = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The Reverb effect is the standard Effects Extension's environmental reverberation effect. It is available on all Generic Software and Generic Hardware devices.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType RingModulator = int32(9)

Docs.summary: The Ring modulator multiplies an input signal by a carrier signal in the time domain, resulting in tremolo or inharmonic effects.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType VocalMorpher = int32(7)

Docs.summary: The Vocal morpher consists of a pair of 4-band formant filters, used to impose vocal tract effects upon the input signal.
